cab.content: SECRET,OPERATIONS,From :- General Delme-Radcliffe, Italy, To:- C.I.G.S., War Office.Received 9.50 a.m. 22.11,1917.738. November 21st. Evening situation.3rd Army. Attack on enemy at Zens on not entirely successful. At 2 p,m. on November 20th the enemy still retained a slight hold on the right bank of river. Con-siderable hostile activity on the front of 3th Corps.4th Army. Enemy's artillery active on the right front between the Piave and Monte Pertica. Italian troops holding Pertica have been continually attacked - the enemy reaching as far as the wire entanglements, but in every case attacks decisively repulsed. Fighting here still continues. Defences of the Grappa are improving steadily.1st Army. Minor fighting in the neighbourhood of Meletta-Di-Callio to-day in which Italians have had the advantage.3rd Army C orps . No change.
